headline: Reddi-wip Owner Conagra Brands' Stock Slides as Inflation Leads to Lowered Outlook
summary: Conagra Brands shares slid Thursday after the food giant lowered its profit outlook, citing a "challenging consumer environment."

headline: Darden Restaurants, Conagra Brands, Dollar Tree: Trending tickers
summary: Wealth host Brad Smith breaks down the latest news on Yahoo Finance's top trending tickers. Darden Restaurants (DRI) shares climbed after the company topped fiscal second quarter earnings expectations, with a strong performance from Olive Garden and LongHorn Steakhouse driving revenue and profit. The restaurant group also raised its full-year 2024 sales forecast. Conagra Brands (CAG) stock declined after the snack maker's decision to reduce its guidance. The company cited persistent inflation and challenging foreign exchange rates as key challenges. Meanwhile, Dollar Tree (DLTR) has appointed Michael Creedon as its new CEO. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: ConAgra Brands Stock Slips After Lowering FY25 Earnings Outlook, CEO Cautions Of Headwinds Ahead
summary: ConAgra Brands, Inc. (NYSE:CAG) shares are trading slightly lower in the morning session on Thursday. The company reported second-quarter adjusted earnings per share of 70 cents, beating the analyst consensus estimate of 67 cents. Quarterly sales of $3.195 billion, beating the street view of $3.149 billion. The results show a 0.4% decrease in net sales, with organic net sales up by 0.3%. headline: ConAgra Brands Q2 profit beats estimates, lowers full-year earnings outlook

headline: Conagra (NYSE:CAG) Exceeds Q4 Expectations
summary: Packaged foods company Conagra Brands (NYSE:CAG) reported Q4 CY2024 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, but sales were flat year on year at $3.20 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.70 per share was 3.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Nike Q2 earnings, mortgage rates update: What to Watch
summary: Market domination hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton detail the top market events investors should be watching for Thursday, December 19. Several major companies are set to report quarterly earnings across the retail and services sectors, including Accenture (ACN), Nike (NKE), FedEx (FDX), Darden Restaurants (DRI), ConAgra Brands (CAG), and Lamb Weston (LW). The health of the housing market will also be in focus as investors await fresh existing home sales data and the weekly mortgage rates report. Additionally, Yahoo Finance will be handing out its 2024 Comeback of the Year award. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Angel Smith
